analyzed: bzod pa'i gtam mam; brtson 'grus kyi gtam mam /
translated: a discourse on diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi gtam mam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi gtam mam /
translated: a discourse on concentration,

original: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: a discourse on insight,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: a discourse on the noble truths,🔽up to a discourse on emergence.

original: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston @398b to; ;de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston @398b to; ;de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He possesses the knowledge of the categories of mind that is very pure.

original: de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa des sems can rnams kyi sems shes par byas shing de dag la de bzhin nyid du chos ston te; sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa des sems can rnams kyi sems shes par byas shing de dag la de bzhin nyid du chos ston te; sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: They teach the Dharma of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam /🔽bzod pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam / bzod pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the Dharma of discipline,🔽the Dharma of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi gtam mam /
translated: the Dharma of diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi gtam mam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi gtam mam /
translated: the Dharma of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: the Dharma of insight,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: and the Dharma of the truths of the noble ones,

original: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
translated: up to the Dharma of the elements.

original: de bdag gam gzhan gyi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du mar rjes su dran te sngon gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa des sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan 'di zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi dge 'dun
analyzed: de bdag gam gzhan gyi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du mar rjes su dran te sngon gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa des sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan 'di zhes bya ba nyan thos kyi dge 'dun
translated: “They remember their own and others’ past abodes in many ways. With that knowledge of remembering past abodes, they know, ‘The thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha named so-and-so appeared in the past, together with the saṅgha of hearers.

original: dang bcas pa byung ngo //
analyzed: dang bcas pa byung ngo //
translated: and the rest.🔽🔽

original: zhes bya bar yang shes te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar yang shes te /
translated: “They know this and more.

original: sems can sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa la mos pa gang ji snyed pa de dag la yang dag pa nyid du chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa la mos pa gang ji snyed pa de dag la yang dag pa nyid du chos ston te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma correctly to those who are interested in remembering the former abodes of sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: He teaches the Dharma as the discourse on generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam /🔽bzod pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam / bzod pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on moral discipline,🔽the discourse on patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi gtam mam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on meditative stability,

original: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on wisdom,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on the noble truths,

original: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
translated: up to the discourse on the elements.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed de /🔽bsnyen bkur byas nas mngon par shes @399a *//
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed de / bsnyen bkur byas nas mngon par shes @399a *//
translated: “With his miraculous abilities he goes to the world systems in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, and serves the blessed buddhas.

original: pa'i ye shes kyis sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: pa'i ye shes kyis sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: Having served them, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings with the wisdom of the superknowledges.

original: sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: He teaches the Dharma as the discourse on generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on moral discipline,

original: bzod pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: bzod pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the discourse on patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi gtam mam; bsam gtan gyi gtam mam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi gtam mam; bsam gtan gyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse of insight,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam /
translated: or the discourse of the truths of the noble ones,

original: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
translated: up to the discourse of emergence.

original: de zag pa med pa mngon du bya ba'i shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de zag pa med pa mngon du bya ba'i shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: “He has the knowledge of the manifestation of the uncontaminated, which is extremely pure.

original: de zag pa med pa mngon du bya ba'i shes pa shin tu rig pa des sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: de zag pa med pa mngon du bya ba'i shes pa shin tu rig pa des sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: With that knowledge of the manifestation of the uncontaminated, which is extremely pure, he teaches the Dharma to beings.

original: sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gtam mam /
translated: He teaches the discourse of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam /🔽bzod pa'i gtam mam /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gtam mam / bzod pa'i gtam mam /
translated: the discourse of discipline,🔽the discourse of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse of diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi gtam mam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi gtam mam /
translated: the discourse of insight,🔽the discourse of the truths of the noble ones,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam; 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mam; 'byung ba'i gtam gyi bar du chos ston to //
translated: up to the discourse of emergence.”

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe mngon par shes pa rnams mngon par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, thus should the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom accomplish the superknowledges.

original: de mngon par shes pa shin tu 'dris pa de dag gis lus ci dang ci lta bu yongs su gzung bar 'dod pa de dang de lta bu'i lus yongs su gzung zhing mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa shin tu 'dris pa de dag gis lus ci dang ci lta bu yongs su gzung bar 'dod pa de dang de lta bu'i lus yongs su gzung zhing mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
translated: With those superknowledges well practiced, they take up whatever kind of body they wish to take up, and they work for the welfare of beings in accordance with their aspirations.

original: bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba de dag gis gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba de dag gis gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are not affected by their happiness or suffering.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs @399b pas sprul pa'i skyes bu ni /🔽dgos pa thams cad byed kyang bde ba'am /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs @399b pas sprul pa'i skyes bu ni / dgos pa thams cad byed kyang bde ba'am /
translated: A person emanated by a tathāgata

original: sdug bsngal ba des gos par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba des gos par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: performs all the necessary actions, but is not affected by their happiness or suffering.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du🔽chos ston kyang bde ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston kyang bde ba'am /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, standing in the perfection of wisdom, playing with the superknowledges, in world systems of the ten directions as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, teaches the Dharma according to the aspirations of sentient beings,🔽but he is not carried away by that happiness

original: sdug bsngal ba des phrogs bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba des phrogs bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or that suffering.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe de ltar mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse bar byas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe de ltar mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse bar byas te /
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom, should play with the superknowledges in that way.

original: ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de ltar brtse bar byas te /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de ltar brtse bar byas te /
translated: He should play in such a way that a buddhafield is purified and sentient beings are brought to maturity.

original: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par gyur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par gyur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: Without purifying a buddhafield and without maturing beings, one cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, why is that?

original: lam gyi yan lag dang mi ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dang mi ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do //
translated: Unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is not for bodhisattva great beings who do not have the branches of the path.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam gyi yan lag yongs su @400a *//🔽rdzogs par bgyis shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam gyi yan lag yongs su @400a *// rdzogs par bgyis shing /
translated: what are the paths that bodhisattva great beings complete

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam de dag gang lags /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam de dag gang lags /
translated: and then fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / dge ba'i chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dge ba'i chos thams cad ni /
translated: “Subhūti, all wholesome dharmas

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gyi yan lag go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gyi yan lag go /
translated: These are the branches of the path of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: lam gyi yan lag gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos de dag gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos de dag gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: what are the virtuous qualities that are the branches of the path by which one will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood?”

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing de yongs su gtong ba'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing de yongs su gtong ba'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: “From the first production of the mind of awakening onward, one engages in the perfection of generosity, but one does not conceptualize it. When one gives it away, it is because it is empty by its very essence.

original: sbyin pa'o // 'di la yongs su gtong bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'o // 'di la yongs su gtong bar bya'o //
translated: ‘This is generosity. This is what I should give away.

original: bdag gis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: I am the one who gives.’

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: One does not conceptualize these three.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The perfection of generosity liberates oneself from saṃsāra.

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: Furthermore, this liberation

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: is a virtuous quality that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first production of the thought of awakening onward, one practices the perfection of morality, but one does not conceptualize it.

original: de tshul khrims srung ba'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: de tshul khrims srung ba'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When one is observing morality, because of the emptiness of inherent nature, one does not conceptualize these three:

original: tshul khrims so //🔽bdag gis tshul khrims @400b bsrung ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims so // bdag gis tshul khrims @400b bsrung ngo //
translated: ‘This is morality.🔽I am observing morality.

original: 'di'i don du tshul khrims bsrung ngo //🔽zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don du tshul khrims bsrung ngo // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: I am observing morality for the sake of this.’

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The perfection of morality by which one liberates oneself from saṃsāra

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni; lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni; lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: and liberates others is a virtuous quality that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing de bzod pa sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing de bzod pa sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When they cultivate patience, it is because of the emptiness of inherent existence that they do not conceptualize these three:🔽“This is patience.

original: bzod pa'o // bdag gis bzod pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: bzod pa'o // bdag gis bzod pa bsgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating patience.

original: 'di'i don du bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //🔽zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don du bzod pa bsgom par bya'o // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: I am cultivating patience for this purpose.”

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The perfection of patience by which they liberate themselves from saṃsāra

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: and liberate others

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: is a wholesome dharma that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: Beginning from the first generation of the mind of enlightenment, they practice the wholesome dharmas of the perfection of effort, but they do not conceptualize it.

original: de brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: de brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When they make effort, it is because of the emptiness of inherent existence that they do not conceptualize these three:

original: brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus so //
translated: “This is effort.

original: bdag gis brtson 'grus brtsam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis brtson 'grus brtsam mo //
translated: I will make an effort.

original: 'di'i don du brtson 'grus brtsam mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du brtson 'grus brtsam mo //
translated: I will make an effort for this.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /🔽brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: In this way, they do not conceptualize those three.

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni; lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //🔽sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni; lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so // sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: The perfection of effort is the virtuous factor that is a requisite of enlightenment because it liberates oneself from cyclic existence and liberates others.

original: de bsam gtan @401a *//
analyzed: de bsam gtan @401a *//
translated: From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattvas practice the perfection of meditative absorption, which is a virtuous factor, without conceptualizing it.

original: la mnyam par gzhog pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: la mnyam par gzhog pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When they enter into meditative absorption, they do so because meditative absorption is empty of its own essence.

original: bsam gtan no //🔽bdag gis bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag go /
analyzed: bsam gtan no // bdag gis bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag go /
translated: This is meditative absorption.🔽I am entering into meditative absorption.

original: 'di'i don du bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag go /
analyzed: 'di'i don du bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag go /
translated: I am entering into meditative absorption for this.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: In this way, they do not conceptualize those three.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The perfection of meditative absorption is that by which one is liberated from saṃsāra and

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: liberates others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is a virtuous quality that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing de shes rab sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing de shes rab sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: From the first generation of the mind of awakening onward, one practices the virtuous qualities of the perfection of insight, but one does not conceptualize them. When one cultivates insight, it is because of the emptiness of inherent nature that one does not conceptualize these three:

original: shes rab bo //🔽bdag gis ni /
analyzed: shes rab bo // bdag gis ni /
translated: “This is insight.

original: shes rab bsgom mo //
analyzed: shes rab bsgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating insight.

original: 'di'i don du shes rab bsgom mo //🔽zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don du shes rab bsgom mo // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: I am cultivating insight for this purpose.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The perfection of insight is that by which one is liberated from saṃsāra and

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: liberates others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is a virtuous quality that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos nang stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /🔽nang stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos nang stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing / nang stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: “From the time when they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattvas practice the teachings of emptiness, but they do not conceptualize them.

original: nang stong pa nyid do //🔽bdag gis nang stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid do // bdag gis nang stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When they meditate on inner emptiness, they do not think, ‘This is inner emptiness,🔽I am meditating on inner emptiness,

original: 'di'i don du nang stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du nang stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: I am meditating on inner emptiness for the sake of this or that.’

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: They do not conceptualize any of these three things.

original: nang stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol @401b zhing; gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol @401b zhing; gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: The inner emptiness that liberates both oneself and others from saṃsāra

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: is the virtuous factor that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos phyi stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos phyi stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: “From the time when they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattvas practice the teachings of outer emptiness, but they do not conceptualize them.

original: phyi stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When they meditate on outer emptiness, they do not think, ‘This is outer emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid do //🔽bdag gis phyi stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid do // bdag gis phyi stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: It is external emptiness.🔽I must cultivate external emptiness.

original: 'di'i don du phyi stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du phyi stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating external emptiness for the sake of that.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: He does not think about those three.

original: phyi stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: External emptiness liberates oneself from cyclic existence

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: and also liberates others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the virtuous factor that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the time of first generating the thought of enlightenment, he practices the virtuous factor of the emptiness of the internal and the emptiness of the external, but he does not think about them.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When he cultivates the emptiness of the internal and the external, because of the emptiness of own-being,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid do //🔽bdag gis phyi nang stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid do // bdag gis phyi nang stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: it is the emptiness of the internal and the external.🔽I must cultivate the emptiness of the internal and the external.

original: 'di'i don du phyi nang stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du phyi nang stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating the emptiness of the internal and the external for the sake of that.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: He does not think about those three.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: This is the emptiness of emptiness.

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: This emptiness of emptiness

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //🔽sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so // sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: is profound, hard to see, and hard to comprehend.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: Those who are skilled in this emptiness of emptiness🔽are the ones who will attain the highest enlightenment.🔽The emptiness of the great

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: is the great emptiness.🔽The great is the aggregates, the elements, and the sense fields.

original: bdag gis stong pa nyid stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis stong pa nyid stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The aggregates are the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the formation aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.🔽The elements are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element.🔽The sense fields are the sense field of the eye and form, the sense field of the ear and sound, the sense field of the nose and smell, the sense field of the tongue and taste, the sense field of the body and touch, and the sense field of the mind and phenomena.🔽The emptiness of that which is great is the great emptiness.

original: 'di'i don du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid @402a *//
analyzed: 'di'i don du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid @402a *//
translated: This great emptiness

original: bsgom mo // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom mo // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: is profound, hard to see, and hard to comprehend.🔽Those who are skilled in this great emptiness

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /🔽gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /🔽lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /🔽gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /🔽lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: are the ones who will attain the highest enlightenment.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos chen po stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos chen po stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first production of the thought of awakening, they practice the great wholesome dharmas of emptiness, but they do not conceptualize them.

original: chen po stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When they cultivate the emptiness of the great, because of the emptiness of their own essence,

original: chen po stong pa nyid do //🔽bdag gis chen po stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid do // bdag gis chen po stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: this is the emptiness of the great.🔽I should cultivate the emptiness of the great.

original: 'di'i don du chen po stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du chen po stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: I cultivate the emptiness of the great for the sake of this.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog ba ste; chen po stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog ba ste; chen po stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: They do not conceptualize these three, and by the emptiness of the great, they liberate themselves from saṃsāra,

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: and they liberate others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the wholesome dharma that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first production of the thought of awakening, they practice the wholesome dharmas of the emptiness of the ultimate, but they do not conceptualize them.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When cultivating the emptiness of the ultimate, one does not conceptualize the three—

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid do //🔽bdag gis don dam pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid do // bdag gis don dam pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: “This is the emptiness of the ultimate,”🔽“I am cultivating the emptiness of the ultimate,”

original: 'di'i don du don dam pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo //🔽zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don du don dam pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: “For this purpose I am cultivating the emptiness of the ultimate.”

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is that by which one is liberated from saṃsāra and

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: by which others are liberated.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the virtuous factor that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos 'dus byas @402b stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos 'dus byas @402b stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first production of the thought of awakening onward, one practices the conditioned emptiness of virtuous factors, but one does not conceptualize it.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When cultivating the emptiness of the conditioned, one does not conceptualize the three—

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: “This is the emptiness of the conditioned,”

original: bdag gis 'dus byas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'dus byas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: “I am cultivating the emptiness of the conditioned,”🔽“For this purpose I am cultivating the emptiness of the conditioned.”

original: 'di'i don du 'dus byas stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du 'dus byas stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: For this purpose, one should cultivate the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: One should not conceptualize these three.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned is that by which one liberates oneself from cyclic existence

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: and liberates others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the virtuous factor that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first generation of the mind of enlightenment, one practices the unconditioned emptiness of virtuous factors, but one does not conceptualize it.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When cultivating the emptiness of the unconditioned, it is the emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: bdag gis 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I should cultivate the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: 'di'i don du 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: For this purpose, one should cultivate the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: One should not conceptualize these three.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The emptiness of the unconditioned is that by which one liberates oneself from cyclic existence🔽and liberates others.

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: Furthermore, this liberation

original: lam gyi yan lag dge bar chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge bar chos so //
translated: is a virtuous quality that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first generation of the mind of enlightenment onward, although one practices the infinite virtuous qualities of the perfection of wisdom, one does not conceptualize them.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When one meditates on the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, because of the emptiness of inherent nature,

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: this is the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: bdag gis mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I will meditate on the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: 'di'i don @403a *//
analyzed: 'di'i don @403a *//
translated: For the sake of this,

original: du mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: du mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: I will meditate on the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: One does not conceptualize these three.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: Through the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, one liberates oneself from saṃsāra

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: and also liberates others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is a virtuous quality that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed ba nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed ba nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first production of the thought of awakening, they practice the emptiness of beginningless and endless wholesome dharmas, but they do not conceptualize it.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When they cultivate the emptiness of beginningless and endless, because of the emptiness of inherent nature,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: this is the emptiness of beginningless and endless.

original: bdag gis thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I should cultivate the emptiness of beginningless and endless.

original: 'di'i don du thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: I cultivate the emptiness of beginningless and endless for this purpose.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: They do not conceptualize these three.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The emptiness of beginningless and endless is that by which they liberate themselves from saṃsāra

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: and liberate others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the wholesome dharma that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the time they first give rise to bodhicitta, they practice the emptiness of nonrejection of virtuous dharmas, but they do not conceptualize it.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When they meditate on the emptiness of nonrejection, because of the emptiness of inherent existence,

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do //🔽bdag gis dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do // bdag gis dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: this is the emptiness of nonrejection.🔽I should meditate on the emptiness of nonrejection.

original: 'di'i don du dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: I meditate on the emptiness of nonrejection for the sake of this.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: They do not conceptualize those three.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol @403b zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol @403b zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: The emptiness of nonrejection by which they liberate themselves from saṃsāra and liberate others is

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: the virtuous dharmas that are branches of the path.

analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /

analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /

analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di @404a *//

analyzed: 'di'i don du rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid bsgom mo //

translated: liberates others.🔽This is the virtuous factor that is a branch of the path.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so; ;sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so; ;sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first generation of the mind of bodhicitta onward, one practices the emptiness of the nonobservation of virtuous dharmas, but one does not conceptualize that.

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //🔽bdag gis mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do // bdag gis mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This is the emptiness of the nonobservation of phenomena.🔽I will cultivate the emptiness of the nonobservation of phenomena.

original: 'di'i don du mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: I meditate on the emptiness of the nonobservation of phenomena for the sake of this.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /

translated: liberates others.🔽This is the virtuous factor that is a branch of the path.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first generation of the mind of awakening onward, one practices the emptiness of the unreality of things, but one does not conceptualize it.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When one meditates on the emptiness of the unreality of things, it is the emptiness of the unreality of things because it is empty by its very essence.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //🔽bdag gis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do // bdag gis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: 'di'i don du dngos po med pa stong pa nyid bsgom mo //

translated: From the time of their first production of the thought, they practice the wholesome states that are empty of intrinsic nature, but they do not conceptualize them.

analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do // bdag gis ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When they cultivate the emptiness of intrinsic nature, they do not think, “This is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.🔽I am cultivating the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

translated: The virtuous factors that are branches of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos stobs lnga la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /

translated: From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings practice the seven factors of awakening, the virtuous factors, while not conceptualizing them.

original: stobs rnams sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /🔽stobs rnams so //
analyzed: stobs rnams sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni / stobs rnams so //

translated: I will cultivate the powers for this purpose.”

analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //

analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings practice the seven factors of awakening, the virtuous factors, while not conceptualizing them.

analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
translated: When they practice the factors of awakening, they do not form any concepts about the three spheres, thinking,

analyzed: 'di'i don du byang chub kyi yan lag rnams bsgom mo // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /

analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //🔽sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so // sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: are the virtuous factors of the path.🔽“From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings practice the noble eightfold path, the virtuous factors of the path, without forming any concepts about the three spheres.

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment onwards, the bodhisattva, the great being, practices the four noble truths, the virtuous factor, without forming any mental constructions in regard to them.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //

original: bdag gis 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: 'di'i don du 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bsgom mo //
translated: For this purpose, I will cultivate the noble truths.

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /

original: lam gyi yan lag dag pa'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dag pa'i chos so //

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos bsam gtan bzhi la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos bsam gtan bzhi la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /

analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
translated: “From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings practice the four formless absorptions, those virtuous dharmas of bodhisattvas, but they do not form mental constructs about them.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //

translated: Beginning from the first generation of the mind of awakening, bodhisattva great beings practice the eight liberations, but they do not conceptualize them.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad do //
translated: When they cultivate the eight liberations, they do not think, ‘These are the eight liberations,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: “From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings practice the nine successive meditative absorptions, but they do not form mental constructs about them.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
translated: When they cultivate the nine successive meditative absorptions, they do not form mental constructs about them in three ways:

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //🔽bdag gis mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so // bdag gis mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: ‘These are the nine successive meditative absorptions.🔽I will cultivate the nine successive meditative absorptions.

original: 'di'i don du mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom mo //
translated: I am cultivating the nine successive meditative absorptions.🔽I have cultivated the nine successive meditative absorptions.’

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /🔽mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /🔽gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /

translated: They do not form mental constructs about them in these three ways.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: The nine successive meditative absorptions are the virtuous attributes that are branches of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos rnam @408a *//
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos rnam @408a *//
translated: “From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings practice the good dharmas of bodhisattvas.

original: par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /🔽rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
analyzed: par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
translated: They practice the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation, but they do not conceptualize them.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //🔽bdag gis rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o // bdag gis rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When they cultivate the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation, they do not conceptualize them as ‘emptiness,’ ‘signlessness,’ or ‘wishlessness.’🔽Why is that? Because they are empty of essence.🔽They think, ‘I should cultivate the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation.

original: 'di'i don du rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom mo //
translated: I should cultivate the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation for this purpose.’

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /🔽rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: These three are nonconceptual.🔽The three doors of liberation are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: Through these, one liberates oneself from cyclic existence and liberates others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the virtuous factor that is a branch of the path.🔽From the time of generating the initial thought of awakening, bodhisattva great beings practice virtuous factors, such as the superknowledges.

translated: These three are nonconceptual.

analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the virtuous factor that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: “From the time that they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings practice the virtuous factors of the concentrations, but they do not conceptualize them.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /🔽ting nge 'dzin rnams so //🔽bdag gis ting nge 'dzin rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni / ting nge 'dzin rnams so // bdag gis ting nge 'dzin rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When they cultivate the concentrations, they do not conceptualize them as ‘these are the concentrations,’🔽‘I am cultivating the concentrations,’🔽‘I will cultivate the concentrations,’

original: 'di'i don du ting nge 'dzin rnams bsgom mo //🔽zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don du ting nge 'dzin rnams bsgom mo // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: or ‘I will attain the concentrations.’

original: ting nge 'dzin gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The concentrations by which one liberates oneself from cyclic existence and

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: liberates others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the virtuous factor that is a branch of the path.”

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /🔽gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing / gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
translated: “From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings practice the dhāraṇī gateways of wholesome states, but they do not conceptualize them.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
translated: When they cultivate the dhāraṇī gateways, they do not think, ‘These are the dhāraṇī gateways,🔽I should cultivate the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: bdag gis gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgom par bya'o; ;'di'i don du gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgom mo //🔽zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgom par bya'o; ;'di'i don du gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgom mo // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: I am cultivating the dhāraṇī gateways for this purpose.’

original: gzungs kyi sgo gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The dhāraṇī gateways by which they liberate themselves from saṃsāra

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: and liberate others

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: are the wholesome states that are branches of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la @409a *//
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la @409a *//
translated: “From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings cultivate the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
analyzed: spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
translated: and even when practicing, they do not conceptualize them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams so //🔽bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams so // bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When they cultivate the ten powers of the tathāgatas, they do not conceptualize them as ‘these are the ten powers of the tathāgatas,’🔽‘I am cultivating the ten powers of the tathāgatas,’🔽‘I should cultivate the ten powers of the tathāgatas,’

original: 'di'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgom mo //🔽zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste; de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /🔽gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgom mo // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste; de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing / gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: ‘I am cultivating the ten powers of the tathāgatas for the sake of this,’🔽and so on.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas are the good qualities of the path that liberate oneself and others from saṃsāra.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod kyang de dag la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod kyang de dag la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first production of the thought of awakening onward, bodhisattva great beings practice the good qualities of the path that are the powers of the tathāgatas, but they do not conceptualize them.

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
translated: When cultivating the fearlessnesses, one does not falsely imagine the three—

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams so //🔽bdag gis mi 'jigs pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams so // bdag gis mi 'jigs pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: “These are the fearlessnesses,”🔽“I am cultivating the fearlessnesses,”

original: 'di'i don du mi 'jigs pa rnams bsgom mo //🔽zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don du mi 'jigs pa rnams bsgom mo // zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: “I am cultivating the fearlessnesses for the sake of this.”

original: mi 'jigs pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: By means of the fearlessnesses, one liberates oneself from cyclic existence and

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: liberates others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //🔽sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so // sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: This is the virtuous factor that is a limb of the path.🔽From the time of generating the initial thought of awakening, bodhisattva great beings practice the correct discriminations of virtuous qualities, but they do not falsely imagine them.

original: so so yang dag par @409b rig pa rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
analyzed: so so yang dag par @409b rig pa rnams bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
translated: When cultivating the correct discriminations, one does not falsely imagine the three—

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams so //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams so //
translated: “These are the correct discriminations,”

original: bdag gis so so yang dag par rig pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis so so yang dag par rig pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I must cultivate the correct understandings.

original: 'di'i don du so so yang dag par rig pa rnams bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du so so yang dag par rig pa rnams bsgom mo //
translated: I cultivate the correct understandings for this purpose.🔽’

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: In this way, they do not conceptualize those three.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: The correct understandings that liberate oneself from saṃsāra

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni; lam gyi yan lag dag pa'i chos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni; lam gyi yan lag dag pa'i chos so //
translated: and liberate others are the pure Dharma that is a branch of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos byams pa chen po la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos byams pa chen po la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: “From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, bodhisattva great beings practice the Dharma of great love, but they do not conceptualize it.

original: byams pa chen po bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: byams pa chen po bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When they cultivate great love, it is because it is empty by nature.

original: byams pa chen po'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po'o //
translated: This is great love.

original: bdag gis byams pa chen po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis byams pa chen po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I must cultivate great love.

original: 'di'i don du byams pa chen po bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du byams pa chen po bsgom mo //
translated: I cultivate great love for this purpose.🔽’

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: In this way, they do not conceptualize those three.

original: byams pa chen po gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: byams pa chen po gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: It is the great love that liberates oneself from saṃsāra and

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: liberates others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so; ;sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos snying rje chen po la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so; ;sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos snying rje chen po la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the tenth stage, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the good Dharma of great compassion, but he does not conceptualize it.

original: snying rje chen po bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: snying rje chen po bsgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni /
translated: When he cultivates great compassion, it is because it is empty of inherent nature that he thinks,

original: snying rje chen po'o //🔽bdag gis snying rje chen po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'o // bdag gis snying rje chen po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: ‘This is great compassion.🔽I must cultivate great compassion.

original: 'di'i don du snying rje chen po bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du snying rje chen po bsgom mo //
translated: I cultivate great compassion for their sake.’

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /
translated: He does not conceptualize those three.

original: @410a *// snying rje chen po gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: @410a *// snying rje chen po gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: It is the great compassion that liberates oneself from saṃsāra and

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: liberates others.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the good Dharma that is a limb of the path.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i chos sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing /
translated: “Starting from the first production of the thought, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the good dharmas, the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas, but he does not construct them.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni /
translated: When he cultivates the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas, he does not construct them, thinking:

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
translated: ‘These are the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas.

original: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I must cultivate the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas.

original: 'di'i don du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'di'i don du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom mo //
translated: I cultivate the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas for this purpose.’

original: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
analyzed: zhes gsum po de dag la mi rtog pa ste / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa gang gis bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing /
translated: He does not construct these three.

original: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni /
translated: The eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas are the good dharmas that liberate oneself and others from saṃsāra.

original: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag dge ba'i chos so //
translated: This is the branch of the path.

original: rab 'byor / dge ba'i chos de dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dge ba'i chos de dag ni /
translated: Subhūti, these good dharmas

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam ste /
translated: This is the path of the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: lam des 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems can tshad med pa de dag 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal bar gyur pa dang / brgal ba dang / rgal bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: lam des 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems can tshad med pa de dag 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal bar gyur pa dang / brgal ba dang / rgal bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Through this path, bodhisattva mahāsattvas of the past, present, and future have crossed, are crossing, and will cross the ocean of saṃsāra.

original: lam de yongs su rdzogs par byas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa @410b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: lam de yongs su rdzogs par byas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa @410b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: Having perfected this path, bodhisattva mahāsattvas attain omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byas nas chos kyi 'khor lo skor ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byas nas chos kyi 'khor lo skor ro //
translated: Having attained omniscience, they turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: Having turned the wheel of the Dharma, they benefit beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: From the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines,

original: le'u drug cu brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u drug cu brgyad pa'o ////
translated: Chapter Sixty-Eight.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos lags na /
translated: If those dharmas are the bodhisattva’s dharmas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang lags /
translated: what are the dharmas of a buddha?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor; gang 'di skad du gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin na /
analyzed: rab 'byor; gang 'di skad du gal te chos de dag byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin na /
translated: “Subhūti, you have said, ‘If those dharmas are the bodhisattva’s dharmas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin zhes zer ba ni /
