analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: what are the dharmas of a buddha?’

original: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang chos de dag nyid rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang chos de dag nyid rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zad de /
translated: Subhūti, the dharmas of a buddha are just those dharmas completely and fully awakened to in all ways,

original: de rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: de rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yongs su spong ngo //
translated: and having attained the knowledge of all aspects, they completely abandon all residual impression connections.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “In that respect, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: are the ones who completely and fully awaken to

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha

original: chos thams cad skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: has fully awakened to all dharmas through the wisdom that is united with a single instant,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste /
translated: and therefore he is counted as a Tathāgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @411a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @411a *//
translated: There is a difference between the bodhisattva great being

original: po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la khyad par de yod do //
analyzed: po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la khyad par de yod do //
translated: and the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / zhugs pa'ang gzhan la; 'bras bu la gnas pa'ang gzhan te /
analyzed: dper na / zhugs pa'ang gzhan la; 'bras bu la gnas pa'ang gzhan te /
translated: the one who has entered the stream is one, and the one who has entered the result of stream enterer is another,

original: de gnyis ka'ang 'phags pa'i gang zag ma yin zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'ang 'phags pa'i gang zag ma yin zhes mi bya'o //
translated: but it is not the case that both of them are not noble beings.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the bodhisattva great being

original: bar chad med pa'i lam du zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam du zhugs pa yin /
translated: has entered the uninterrupted path,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni /
translated: and the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha🔽has entered the path of the result.

original: chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa ste; rab 'byor /
analyzed: chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa ste; rab 'byor /
translated: He has attained the wisdom that is unobstructed with regard to all phenomena.

original: de ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Subhūti, this is the difference between a bodhisattva-mahāsattva and a tathāgata, a worthy one, a perfectly, fully enlightened buddha.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos de dag la 'di ni /🔽sems can dmyal ba pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos de dag la 'di ni / sems can dmyal ba pa'o //
translated: then in those phenomena that are empty of their own marks,🔽this is a being in the hells,

original: 'di ni / byol song gi skye gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / byol song gi skye gnas pa'o //
translated: this is an animal,

original: 'di ni / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: this is a being in the world of Yama,

original: 'di ni / lha'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / lha'o //
translated: this is a god,

original: 'di ni / mi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / mi'o //
translated: this is a human,

original: 'di ni / rigs kyi sa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / rigs kyi sa'o //
translated: this is the stage of the family,

original: 'di ni / brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / brgyad pa'o //
translated: this is the eighth stage,

original: 'di ni / rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: this is a stream enterer,

original: 'di ni / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: this is a once-returner,

original: 'di ni / phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: this is a non-returner,

original: 'di ni / dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: this is a worthy one,

original: 'di ni / rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'di ni / rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: ‘this is a pratyekabuddha,’

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems @411b dpa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems @411b dpa'o //
translated: ‘this is a bodhisattva,’

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //🔽zhes bya bar khyad par dang / rnam par dbye bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so // zhes bya bar khyad par dang / rnam par dbye bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: and ‘this is a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha’?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar gang zag de dag dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du las kyang dmigs su ma mchis /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag de dag dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du las kyang dmigs su ma mchis /
translated: just as those persons are not apprehended, so too karma is not apprehended.

original: las ji ltar dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pa'ang dmigs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: las ji ltar dmigs su ma mchis pa de bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pa'ang dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: Just as karma is not apprehended, so too the ripening of karma is not apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so, it is so!

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as it is!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la las dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la las dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: In the emptiness of inherent nature of all phenomena, karma and the ripening of karma are not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / gang gis rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad de ltar ma shes pa de dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gis rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad de ltar ma shes pa de dag ni /
translated: “Subhūti, those who do not know all phenomena to be empty of their own marks

original: ngan par spyod pa'am /
analyzed: ngan par spyod pa'am /
translated: create karma that is negative🔽or positive

original: legs par spyad pa'am /🔽mi g-yo ba'i las mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa'am / mi g-yo ba'i las mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: or unchanging.

original: de dag ngan par spyad pa'i las kyis ngan sang gsum du lhung ngo //
analyzed: de dag ngan par spyad pa'i las kyis ngan sang gsum du lhung ngo //
translated: Because of negative karma, they fall into the three lower realms.

original: legs par spyad pa'i las kyis lha dang / mir skye'o //🔽nyams pa med pa'i las kyis gzugs kyi khams sam /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa'i las kyis lha dang / mir skye'o // nyams pa med pa'i las kyis gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: Because of positive karma, they are born as gods or humans.🔽Because of unchanging karma, they are born in the form realm

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye'o //
translated: or the formless realm.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
translated: practice the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
translated: practice the perfection of moral discipline,🔽practice the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
translated: practice the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
translated: practice the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
translated: and practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: @412a *// nang stong pa nyid la spyad /🔽phyi stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: @412a *// nang stong pa nyid la spyad / phyi stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice inner emptiness.🔽They practice outer emptiness.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyad /🔽stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyad / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice inner and outer emptiness.🔽They practice the emptiness of emptiness.

original: tshan po stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: tshan po stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice great emptiness.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyad /🔽'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyad / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice the emptiness of ultimate reality.🔽They practice the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyad /🔽mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyad /🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyad / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyad / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.🔽They practice the emptiness of beyond extremes.🔽They practice the emptiness of no beginning or end.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice the emptiness of nonrejection.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice the emptiness of defining characteristics.🔽They practice the emptiness of nonapprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyad; dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyad; dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice the emptiness of nonthings.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice the emptiness of essence.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: They practice the emptiness of the nature of nonthings.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyad /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyad /
translated: They practice the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyad /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyad /🔽dbang po rnams la spyad /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyad / dbang po rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the legs of miraculous power,🔽they practice the faculties,

original: stobs rnams la spyad /
analyzed: stobs rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the powers,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyad /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the branches of awakening,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyad /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyad /
translated: they practice the noble eightfold path,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyad /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the truths of the noble ones,

original: bsam gtan rnams la spyad /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the concentrations,

original: tshad med pa rnams la spyad /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the immeasurables,🔽they practice the formless absorptions,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyad; rnam par thar pa rnams la spyad /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyad; rnam par thar pa rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the deliverances,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyad /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the serial absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon @412b pa med pa la spyad /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon @412b pa med pa la spyad /
translated: they practice emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, which are the gateways to liberation,

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la spyad /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the clairvoyances,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyad /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyad /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyad /
translated: they practice the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyad /
translated: They practice the strengths of the thus-gone ones,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyad /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyad /
translated: the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyad /🔽byams pa chen po la spyad /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyad / byams pa chen po la spyad /
translated: the correct understandings,🔽great love,

original: snying rje chen po la spyad /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la spyad /
translated: great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad de /
translated: and the eighteen unique qualities of the Buddha.

original: nyams pa med pa'i spyod pas byang chub kyi lam bskyed nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'khor dang ldan pa la mnyam par bzhag cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
analyzed: nyams pa med pa'i spyod pas byang chub kyi lam bskyed nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'khor dang ldan pa la mnyam par bzhag cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
translated: Having generated the path to awakening through undiminishing practice, they rest in equipoise in the vajra-like absorption endowed with the branches of awakening and fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: rgya ste / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: rgya ste / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: Having fully awakened, they benefit beings.

original: don byas nas ci nas kyang phyis chud mi za shing rgyud lnga'i 'khor bar mi lhung bar de ltar don byed do //
analyzed: don byas nas ci nas kyang phyis chud mi za shing rgyud lnga'i 'khor bar mi lhung bar de ltar don byed do //
translated: Having benefited them, they act in such a way that they will not be lost later and will not fall into the five realms of saṃsāra.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba gzigs sam /
analyzed: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba gzigs sam /
translated: “Is it that the Lord, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, sees the five classes of transmigrating beings in samsara?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / ma yin no //
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not like that.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: ci lags / de bzhin gshegs pas chos nag po'am /
analyzed: ci lags / de bzhin gshegs pas chos nag po'am /
translated: “Lord, is it that the Tathāgata apprehends a dharma that is black,

original: dkar po'am / nag pa dang dkar ba'am /
analyzed: dkar po'am / nag pa dang dkar ba'am /
translated: or white, or black and white,

original: mi nag mi dkar ba dmigs lags sam /
analyzed: mi nag mi dkar ba dmigs lags sam /
translated: or not black and not white?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / ma yin no //
translated: The Lord said,

original: gsol pa / @413a *//
analyzed: gsol pa / @413a *//
translated: “No, it is not like that.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: de ste ma dmigs na /🔽sems can dmyal ba'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: de ste ma dmigs na / sems can dmyal ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: if it is not like that,🔽how does he designate a hell-being,🔽an animal,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: or a world of Yama,

original: lha dang mir ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /🔽rgyun du zhugs par ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: lha dang mir ji ltar gdags pa mdzad / rgyun du zhugs par ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: how does he designate a god or a human,🔽how does he designate a stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong bar ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong bar ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: how does he designate a once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong bar ji ltar gdags pa mdzad; dgra bcom par ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong bar ji ltar gdags pa mdzad; dgra bcom par ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: How does he designate the non-returner? How does he designate the arhat?

original: rang sangs rgyas su ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: How does he designate the pratyekabuddha?

original: byang chub sems par ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: byang chub sems par ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: How does he designate the bodhisattva?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su ji ltar gdags pa mdzad /
translated: How does he designate the tathāgata, arhat, perfectly awakened buddha?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / ci sems can 'di dag chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci sems can 'di dag chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes sam /
translated: “Subhūti, do these sentient beings understand that phenomena are empty of their own marks?”

original: gsol pa / ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, they do not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gal te sems can de dag 'di ltar chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te sems can de dag 'di ltar chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: “Subhūti, if sentient beings understood that phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: zhes bya bar shes na ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bar shes na ni /
translated: then

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi 'jug ste /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings would not enter into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma zhugs na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma zhugs na /
translated: If they had not entered into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can rnams kyang ngan song gsum dang / 'khor ba'i rgyud rnams nas mi 'grol te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang ngan song gsum dang / 'khor ba'i rgyud rnams nas mi 'grol te /
translated: they would not liberate beings from the three lower realms and the realms of cyclic existence.

original: rab 'byor / sems can de dag chos @413b rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can de dag chos @413b rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes pas /
translated: Subhūti, because those beings do not know that dharmas are empty of their own marks,

original: rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi 'grol bas /
analyzed: rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi 'grol bas /
translated: they are not liberated from the five realms of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par thos nas sems can rnams kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par thos nas sems can rnams kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having heard from those buddha bhagavāns that all dharmas are empty of their own marks, enter into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of beings.

original: chos 'di dag ni; ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mngon par chags par bya ba de ltar yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni; ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mngon par chags par bya ba de ltar yod pa ma yin na /
translated: “These dharmas do not exist as they are clung to by foolish, ordinary beings.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They are

original: med cing yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la yod par brtags shing /
analyzed: med cing yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la yod par brtags shing /
translated: They imagine that nonexistent and unreal phenomena exist.

original: sems can med pa la sems can du 'du shes /
analyzed: sems can med pa la sems can du 'du shes /
translated: They perceive sentient beings where there are no sentient beings.

original: gzugs med pa la gzugs su 'du shes /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la gzugs su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive form where there is no form.

original: tshor ba med pa la tshor bar 'du shes /
analyzed: tshor ba med pa la tshor bar 'du shes /
translated: They perceive feelings where there are no feelings.

original: 'du shes med pa la 'du shes su 'du shes /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa la 'du shes su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive perceptions where there are no perceptions.

original: 'du byed med pa la 'du byed du 'du shes /
analyzed: 'du byed med pa la 'du byed du 'du shes /
translated: They perceive formative predispositions where there are no formative predispositions.

original: rnam par shes pa med pa la rnam par shes par 'du shes /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa la rnam par shes par 'du shes /
translated: They perceive consciousness where there is no consciousness.

original: mig med pa la mig tu 'du shes /🔽rna ba med pa la rna bar 'du shes /🔽sna med pa la snar 'du shes /
analyzed: mig med pa la mig tu 'du shes / rna ba med pa la rna bar 'du shes / sna med pa la snar 'du shes /
translated: They perceive eyes where there are no eyes.🔽They perceive ears where there are no ears.🔽They perceive noses where there are no noses.

original: lce med pa la lcer 'du shes /
analyzed: lce med pa la lcer 'du shes /
translated: They perceive tongues where there are no tongues.

original: lus med pa la lus su 'du shes /
analyzed: lus med pa la lus su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive bodies where there are no bodies.

original: yid med pa la yid du 'du shes /
analyzed: yid med pa la yid du 'du shes /
translated: They perceive minds where there are no minds.

original: gzugs med pa la gzugs su 'du shes /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la gzugs su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive forms where there are no forms.

original: sgra med pa la sgrar 'du shes /🔽dri med pa la drir 'du shes /
analyzed: sgra med pa la sgrar 'du shes / dri med pa la drir 'du shes /
translated: They perceive sounds where there are no sounds.🔽They perceive smells where there are no smells.

original: ro med pa la ror 'du shes /🔽reg med pa la reg tu 'du shes /
analyzed: ro med pa la ror 'du shes / reg med pa la reg tu 'du shes /
translated: They perceive tastes where there are no tastes.🔽They perceive textures where there are no textures.

original: chos med pa la chos su 'du shes /
analyzed: chos med pa la chos su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive mental phenomena where there are no mental phenomena.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa la mig @414a *//🔽gi rnam par shes par 'du shes /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa la mig @414a *// gi rnam par shes par 'du shes /
translated: “They have the idea that there is eye consciousness where there is no eye consciousness.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa med pa la rna ba'i rnam par shes par 'du shes /🔽sna'i rnam par shes pa med pa la sna'i rnam par shes par 'du shes /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa med pa la rna ba'i rnam par shes par 'du shes / sna'i rnam par shes pa med pa la sna'i rnam par shes par 'du shes /
translated: They have the idea that there is ear consciousness where there is no ear consciousness.🔽They have the idea that there is nose consciousness where there is no nose consciousness.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa med pa la lce'i rnam par shes par 'du shes /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa med pa la lce'i rnam par shes par 'du shes /
translated: They have the idea that there is tongue consciousness where there is no tongue consciousness.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa med pa la lus kyi rnam par shes par 'du shes /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa med pa la lus kyi rnam par shes par 'du shes /
translated: They have the idea that there is body consciousness where there is no body consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa la yid kyi rnam par shes par 'du shes /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa la yid kyi rnam par shes par 'du shes /
translated: They have the idea that there is thinking-mind consciousness where there is no thinking-mind consciousness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa med pa la mig gi 'dus te reg par 'du shes /🔽rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa med pa la rna ba'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes /🔽sna'i 'dus te reg pa med pa la sna'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa med pa la mig gi 'dus te reg par 'du shes / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa med pa la rna ba'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes / sna'i 'dus te reg pa med pa la sna'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes /
translated: They have the idea that there is eye contact where there is no eye contact.🔽They have the idea that there is ear contact where there is no ear contact.🔽They have the idea that there is nose contact where there is no nose contact.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa med pa la lce'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa med pa la lce'i 'dus te reg par 'du shes /
translated: They have the idea that there is tongue contact where there is no tongue contact.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa med pa la lus kyi 'dus te reg par 'du shes /
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa med pa la lus kyi 'dus te reg par 'du shes /
translated: They perceive physical contact where there is no physical contact.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa med pa la yid kyi 'dus te reg par 'du shes /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa med pa la yid kyi 'dus te reg par 'du shes /
translated: They perceive mental contact where there is no mental contact.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes /🔽rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes /🔽sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes /
translated: They perceive the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact where there is no feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.🔽They perceive the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact where there is no feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact.🔽They perceive the feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact where there is no feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la lce'i 'dus te @414b reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la lce'i 'dus te @414b reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes /
translated: They perceive the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue contact where there is no feeling that arises from the condition of tongue contact.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes /
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes /
translated: They perceive the feeling that arises from the condition of body contact where there is no feeling that arises from the condition of body contact.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba med pa la yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bar 'du shes /
translated: They perceive the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of eye, form, and consciousness, which is not the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of eye, form, and consciousness, as the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of eye, form, and consciousness.

original: sa'i khams med pa la sa'i khams su 'du shes /
analyzed: sa'i khams med pa la sa'i khams su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive the earth element, which is not the earth element, as the earth element.🔽They perceive the water element, which is not the water element, as the water element.

original: chu'i khams med pa la chu'i khams su 'du shes; me'i khams med pa la me'i khams su 'du shes /
analyzed: chu'i khams med pa la chu'i khams su 'du shes; me'i khams med pa la me'i khams su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive the fire element, which is not the fire element, as the fire element.

original: rlung gi khams med pa la rlung gi khams su 'du shes /
analyzed: rlung gi khams med pa la rlung gi khams su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive the wind element, which is not the wind element, as the wind element.

original: nam mkha'i khams med pa la nam mkha'i khams su 'du shes /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams med pa la nam mkha'i khams su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive the space element, which is not the space element, as the space element.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa la rnam par shes pa'i khams su 'du shes /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa la rnam par shes pa'i khams su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive the consciousness element, which is not the consciousness element, as the consciousness element.

original: ma rig pa med pa la ma rig par 'du shes /
analyzed: ma rig pa med pa la ma rig par 'du shes /
translated: They perceive ignorance, which is not ignorance, as ignorance.

original: 'du byed med pa la 'du byed du 'du shes /
analyzed: 'du byed med pa la 'du byed du 'du shes /
translated: They perceive volitional factors, which are not volitional factors, as volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa med pa la rnam par shes par 'du shes /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa la rnam par shes par 'du shes /
translated: They perceive consciousness, which is not consciousness, as consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs med pa la ming dang gzugs su 'du shes /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs med pa la ming dang gzugs su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive name and form, which are not name and form, as name and form.

original: skye mched drug med pa la skye mched drug tu 'du shes /
analyzed: skye mched drug med pa la skye mched drug tu 'du shes /
translated: They perceive the six sense sources, which are not the six sense sources, as the six sense sources.

original: reg pa med pa la reg par 'du shes /
analyzed: reg pa med pa la reg par 'du shes /
translated: They perceive contact where there is no contact.

original: tshor ba med pa la tshor bar 'du shes /🔽sred pa med pa la sred par 'du shes /
analyzed: tshor ba med pa la tshor bar 'du shes / sred pa med pa la sred par 'du shes /
translated: They perceive feeling where there is no feeling.🔽They perceive craving where there is no craving.

original: len pa med pa la len par 'du shes /
analyzed: len pa med pa la len par 'du shes /
translated: They perceive appropriation where there is no appropriation.

original: srid pa med pa la srid par 'du shes /
analyzed: srid pa med pa la srid par 'du shes /
translated: They perceive existence where there is no existence.

original: skye ba med pa la skye bar 'du shes /
analyzed: skye ba med pa la skye bar 'du shes /
translated: They perceive birth where there is no birth.

original: rga shi med pa la rga shir 'du shes /🔽'jig rten pa'i chos med pa la 'jig rten pa'i chos su 'du shes /
analyzed: rga shi med pa la rga shir 'du shes / 'jig rten pa'i chos med pa la 'jig rten pa'i chos su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive aging and death where there is no aging and death.🔽They perceive mundane phenomena where there are no mundane phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos med pa la 'jig rten @415a *//🔽las 'das pa'i chos su 'du shes /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos med pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos med pa la 'jig rten @415a *// las 'das pa'i chos su 'du shes / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos med pa la /
translated: They perceive supramundane phenomena where there are no supramundane phenomena.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos su 'du shes /🔽zag pa med pa'i chos med pa la zag pa med pa'i chos su 'du shes /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos su 'du shes / zag pa med pa'i chos med pa la zag pa med pa'i chos su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive phenomena with defilements where there are no phenomena with defilements.🔽They perceive phenomena without defilements where there are no phenomena without defilements.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos med pa la 'dus byas kyi chos su 'du shes /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos med pa la 'dus byas kyi chos su 'du shes /
translated: They perceive conditioned phenomena where there are no conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos med pa la 'dus ma byas kyi chos su 'du shes nas yod pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log gis phyin ci log tu gyur ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams /🔽lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed pa de dag rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi 'grol ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus par byas te byang chub sems dpa'i spyad
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos med pa la 'dus ma byas kyi chos su 'du shes nas yod pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log gis phyin ci log tu gyur ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las mngon par 'du byed pa de dag rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi 'grol ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus par byas te byang chub sems dpa'i spyad
translated: Those who have a mind that is distorted by the distortion of the non-existent, who perceive non-compounded dharmas as non-compounded dharmas,

original: pa spyod cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: pa spyod cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, having gathered all wholesome dharmas into the perfection of wisdom, practice the bodhisattva conduct and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las sems can rnams yongs su 'grol to ////
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las sems can rnams yongs su 'grol to ////
translated: Having fully awakened, they liberate sentient beings from the five-stream saṃsāra.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyis brgya go dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po nyis brgya go dgu pa /
translated: Chapter 19

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
translated: “If all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las sems can rnams @415b yongs su 'grol ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las sems can rnams @415b yongs su 'grol ba lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and liberate sentient beings from the five forms of rebirth in saṃsāra?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and teach sentient beings suffering,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang /
translated: the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam sems can rnams la ston to //🔽'chad do // 'jog go /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam sems can rnams la ston to // 'chad do // 'jog go /
translated: and the path to the cessation of suffering.🔽They explain,🔽establish,

original: 'god do // 'grel to //
analyzed: 'god do // 'grel to //
translated: and expound

original: rnam par 'grel to //🔽gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel to // gsal bar byed do //
translated: He elucidates them.🔽He illuminates them.

original: yang dag par brjod do //
analyzed: yang dag par brjod do //
translated: He explains them.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin po 'dir dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs gang ji snyed pa gang gis dkon mchog gsum rnam par 'god pa de thams cad yongs su 'dus te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin po 'dir dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs gang ji snyed pa gang gis dkon mchog gsum rnam par 'god pa de thams cad yongs su 'dus te /
translated: In this fourfold noble truth, all the wholesome dharmas that are the factors of awakening are included, by which the Three Jewels are established.

original: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog gsum 'jig rten du byung bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog gsum 'jig rten du byung bas /
translated: The Three Jewels—the Buddha Jewel, the Dharma Jewel, and the Saṅgha Jewel—appear in the world,

original: sems can rnams lam rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su 'grol to //
analyzed: sems can rnams lam rgyud lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su 'grol to //
translated: and sentient beings are completely liberated from the five destinies of saṃsāra.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽sdug bsngal 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / sdug bsngal 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Blessed One,🔽is nirvāṇa attained by knowing suffering,

original: 'on te sdug bsngal gyis mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal gyis mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: or is nirvāṇa attained by suffering?🔽Is nirvāṇa attained by knowing the origin,

original: kun 'byung ba 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram; 'on te kun 'byung bas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram; 'on te kun 'byung bas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: or is nirvāṇa attained by the origin?

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Is it by knowing the cessation of suffering that one attains nirvana,

original: 'on te sdug bsngal 'gog pas mya @416a *//🔽ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /🔽lam 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal 'gog pas mya @416a *// ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur / lam 'tshal bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ram /
translated: or is it by the cessation of suffering that one attains nirvana?🔽Is it by knowing the path that one attains nirvana,

original: 'on te lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: or is it by the path that one attains nirvana?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Subhūti, one does not attain nirvana by knowing suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor by suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: One does not attain nirvana by knowing the origin,

original: kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor by the origin.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: One does not attain nirvana by knowing the cessation of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor by the cessation of suffering.

original: lam shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: lam shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: One does not attain nirvana by knowing the path,

original: lam gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: lam gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor by the path.

original: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni /🔽mya ngan las 'da' bar ngas gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni / mya ngan las 'da' bar ngas gsungs te /
translated: The four noble truths are not joined with the Reality limit, nor are they disjoined.

original: sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin no //🔽sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin no // sdug bsngal gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: The Reality limit is not joined with the four noble truths, nor is it disjoined.🔽The four noble truths are not joined with the inconceivable element, nor are they disjoined.🔽The inconceivable element is not joined with the four noble truths, nor is it disjoined.🔽The four noble truths are not joined with the unthinkable element, nor are they disjoined.🔽The unthinkable element is not joined with the four noble truths, nor is it disjoined.

original: kun 'byung ba shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin; kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no //🔽sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas /🔽yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin; kun 'byung bas kyang ma yin no // sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pas / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
translated: The four noble truths are not joined with the unsurpassed element, nor are they disjoined.🔽The unsurpassed element is not joined with the four noble truths, nor is it disjoined.🔽The four noble truths are not joined with the endless element, nor are they disjoined.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no //🔽lam shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pas kyang ma yin no // lam shes pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin /
translated: The endless element is not joined with the four noble truths, nor is it disjoined.

original: lam gyis kyang ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: lam gyis kyang ma yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The four noble truths are not joined with the element that is the same both ways, nor are they disjoined.

original: gang la sdug bsngal yang ma mchis /🔽sdug bsngal 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis /🔽kun @416b 'byung ba'ang ma mchis /🔽kun 'byung ba 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: gang la sdug bsngal yang ma mchis / sdug bsngal 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis / kun @416b 'byung ba'ang ma mchis / kun 'byung ba 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis /
translated: The element that is the same both ways is not joined with the four noble truths, nor is it disjoined.🔽The four noble truths are not joined with the element that is without differentiations, nor are they disjoined.🔽The element that is without differentiations is not joined with the four noble truths, nor is it disjoined.

original: 'gog pa'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: 'gog pa'ang ma mchis /
translated: The four noble truths are not joined with the element that is unagitated, nor are they disjoined.🔽The element that is unagitated is not joined with the four noble truths

original: 'gog pa 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: 'gog pa 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis /
translated: There is no cessation.

original: lam yang ma mchis /
analyzed: lam yang ma mchis /
translated: There is no path.🔽There is no one who seeks the path.

original: lam 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba de gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: lam 'tshal ba'ang ma mchis pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba de gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: What is meant by the sameness of the four noble truths?”🔽The Blessed One replied, “It is the suchness of those four noble truths, their unmistaken suchness, their unaltered suchness, their nature, their realm, the sphere of reality,

original: de ni / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag gi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin la de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang /
analyzed: de ni / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag gi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin la de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang /
translated: the true nature of reality,

original: chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de ni /
analyzed: chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de ni /
translated: the absence of flaws in reality, and the limit of reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: Whether the thus-gone ones appear or not,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: whether the thus-gone ones do not appear or do appear,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings chos kyi dbyings mi nyams mi 'grib par 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings chos kyi dbyings mi nyams mi 'grib par 'dug pa ste /
translated: the realm of the thus-gone ones, the sphere of reality, remains without decline or diminution.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe bden pa khong du chud par ji ltar bya ba bzhin du bden pa khong du chud par bya ba'i don du spyod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe bden pa khong du chud par ji ltar bya ba bzhin du bden pa khong du chud par bya ba'i don du spyod do //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they practice for the sake of realizing the truth just as it is.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyod na /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: bden pa rtogs pa'i don du spyod pa lags /
analyzed: bden pa rtogs pa'i don du spyod pa lags /
translated: How do they practice for the sake of realizing the truth?

original: ji ltar spyod na /🔽bden pa rtogs shing 'tshal te khong du chud nas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar spyod na / bden pa rtogs shing 'tshal te khong du chud nas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: How do they practice

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug pa lags /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug pa lags /
translated: so that, having realized, understood, and comprehended the truth, they do not fall into the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha levels, but enter the faultless state of a bodhisattva?

original: bcom @417a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @417a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos de dag ci nas kyang chos gang yang dmigs su med pa de ltar mthong ste /🔽chos thams cad ma dmigs pas bden par rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos de dag ci nas kyang chos gang yang dmigs su med pa de ltar mthong ste / chos thams cad ma dmigs pas bden par rtogs pa'am /
translated: Subhuti: Here a Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in the perfection of wisdom, sees all these dharmas in such a way that he does not apprehend any dharma at all.🔽He sees all dharmas as empty.

original: bden par ma rtogs pa'i chos thams cad stong par mthong ste /
analyzed: bden par ma rtogs pa'i chos thams cad stong par mthong ste /
translated: And because he does not apprehend any dharma, he does not see any dharma as true or untrue.

original: des de ltar mthong bas skyon med par chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rigs kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des de ltar mthong bas skyon med par chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rigs kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: When he sees thus, he enters into the certainty of perfection, and he stands on the irreversible stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur nas spyi bor ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur nas spyi bor ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: And when he stands on the irreversible stage, he does not fall on the level of a Disciple or a Pratyekabuddha.

original: de na nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de na nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: He does not fall on the level of a Disciple or a Pratyekabuddha,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba'i spyi bor ltung ba med do //🔽de byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi sa de la gnas shing bsam gtan bzhi sgrub bo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba'i spyi bor ltung ba med do //🔽de byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi sa de la gnas shing bsam gtan bzhi sgrub bo //
translated: and he does not fall on the level of a Buddha.🔽He does not fall on any of these levels, but he does not fall away from the knowledge of all modes.

original: tshad med pa bzhi sgrub bo //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi sgrub bo //
translated: He accomplishes the four immeasurables.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi sgrub bo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi sgrub bo //
translated: He accomplishes the four formless concentrations.

original: de lhag mthong gis de la gnas shing /
analyzed: de lhag mthong gis de la gnas shing /
translated: He abides in them through insight.

original: chos thams cad rab tu shes par byed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad rab tu shes par byed de /
translated: He knows all dharmas.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud par byed do //
translated: He penetrates the four noble truths.

original: de sdug bsngal yongs su shes kyang sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sems mi skyed do //
analyzed: de sdug bsngal yongs su shes kyang sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sems mi skyed do //
translated: He fully knows suffering, but he does not generate a mind that focuses on suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba rab tu spangs kyang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i sems mi skyed do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba rab tu spangs kyang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i sems mi skyed do //
translated: He abandons the origin, but he does not generate a mind that focuses on the origin.

original: 'gog pa mngon du byed kyang 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i sems mi skyed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byed kyang 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i sems mi skyed do //
translated: He manifests cessation, but he does not generate a mind that focuses on cessation.

original: lam sgom yang lam la dmigs pa'i @417b sems mi skyed do //
analyzed: lam sgom yang lam la dmigs pa'i @417b sems mi skyed do //
translated: He cultivates the path, but he does not generate a mind that focuses on the path.

original: gzhan du na byang chub la gzhol ba'i sems kyis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du byed pa mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du na byang chub la gzhol ba'i sems kyis chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du byed pa mthong bar byed do //
translated: Rather, with a mind directed toward awakening, he sees all dharmas as they are.🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba de gang lags /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba de gang lags /
translated: What is the suchness of all phenomena?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid do //
translated: “Emptiness.”

original: gsol pa / stong pa nyid gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / stong pa nyid gang lags /
translated: “What is emptiness?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de /
translated: “The emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics.”

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i lhag mthong gis chos thams cad stong pa'o //🔽zhes bya bar lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i lhag mthong gis chos thams cad stong pa'o // zhes bya bar lta ste /
translated: “One should view all phenomena as empty through such insight.

original: ngo bo nyid gang la gnas shing byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid chos gang la'ang ngo bo nyid yod par mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang la gnas shing byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid chos gang la'ang ngo bo nyid yod par mi mthong ngo //
translated: One does not see any phenomenon that has an intrinsic nature in which one could abide and awaken to perfect buddhahood.

original: dngos po med pa ni /🔽byang chub ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni / byang chub ste /
translated: Awakening is non-entity.

original: de ni / sangs rgyas kyis ma mdzad /
analyzed: de ni / sangs rgyas kyis ma mdzad /
translated: It is not created by the buddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
translated: not created by the solitary buddhas,

original: dgra bcom pas ma byas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pas ma byas /
translated: not created by the arhats,

original: phyir mi 'ong bas ma byas /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong bas ma byas /
translated: not created by the non-returners,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong bas ma byas /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong bas ma byas /
translated: not created by the once-returners,🔽and not created by the stream enterers.

original: rgyun du zhugs pas ma byas /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pas ma byas /
translated: It is not created by the stream-enterers.

original: de dag la zhugs pas kyang ma byas /
analyzed: de dag la zhugs pas kyang ma byas /
translated: It is not created by those who have entered the stream.

original: gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma byas te /
translated: It is not created by those bodhisattva great beings who practice this awakening.

original: gzhan du na yang dag pa ji lta ba de sems can rnams kyis mi shes mi mthong bas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: gzhan du na yang dag pa ji lta ba de sems can rnams kyis mi shes mi mthong bas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: Other than that, since beings do not know and do not see the suchness of reality, therefore bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, with skillful means, teach the Dharma to beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @418a *//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @418a *//
translated: Perfection of Wisdom

original: stong phrag brgya pa las //
analyzed: stong phrag brgya pa las //
translated: In One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: le'u drug cu dgu pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u drug cu dgu pa'o ////
translated: Chapter Sixty-Nine

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das; gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis te /
translated: “Blessed One, if all phenomena are unreal

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma mdzad /
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma mdzad /
translated: and not created by the Buddha,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma bgyis /

original: dgra bcom pas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: dgra bcom pas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: nor by arhats,

original: phyir mi 'ong bas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong bas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: nor by nonreturners,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong bas kyang ma bgyis /🔽rgyun du zhugs pas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong bas kyang ma bgyis / rgyun du zhugs pas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: nor by once-returners,🔽nor by stream enterers,

original: de dag la zhugs pas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: de dag la zhugs pas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: nor by those who have entered those [stages],

original: gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma bgyis na /
analyzed: gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang ma bgyis na /
translated: and those bodhisattva great beings who practice this enlightenment have not done so either.

original: chos de dag la 'di dag ni /🔽sems can dmyal ba pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag la 'di dag ni / sems can dmyal ba pa'o //

original: 'di dag ni /🔽gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'o //

analyzed: 'di dag ni /

analyzed: lha'o // 'di dag ni /
translated: these are the gods,🔽these are the humans,

original: mi'o // las 'dis ni /
analyzed: mi'o // las 'dis ni /
translated: and by this karma,

analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mi gdung ba'i lhar skye ba'am / shin tu mthong ba'i lhar skye ba'am /

translated: rebirth as a god of the Vast Virtue of Contentment realm,

analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lhar skye ba'am /

analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi lhar skye ba'am /

analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi lhar skye ba'am /

analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lhar skye ba'am /

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'am /

analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'am /

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'am /

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or attain the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'am /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam la spyod pa'am /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'am /

analyzed: de thob nas sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su dgrol bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i bya ba gang yang med do // zhes zer ba ni /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: lam dngos po med pa ma yin nam / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dngos po med pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'o // lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ni /

analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'o // rang byang chub ni /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni /

analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: de ni / ma lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: gzugs med pa / bstan du med pa /

analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o //

translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they skillfully consider sentient beings who are mistaken about the three

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: nags stug po dang / ri dang / gcong rong dang / lung pa nas sgra brnyan byung na /
translated: When an echo arises from a dense forest, a mountain, a ravine, or a valley,

original: sgra brnyan de las mngon par 'du byed cing /
analyzed: sgra brnyan de las mngon par 'du byed cing /
translated: does that echo form,

original: mngon par 'du byas pas /🔽sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byas pas / sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: and by forming,🔽go to the hells,

original: byol song gi skye gnas su 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su 'gro ba'am /
translated: go to the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'am /
translated: go to the world of Yama,

original: lha dang mir 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dngos po yod dam /
analyzed: lha dang mir 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dngos po yod dam /
translated: or become a god or human?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni / ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni / ma lags te /
translated: it does not.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sgra brnyan de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis na /
analyzed: sgra brnyan de nyid kyang dngos po ma mchis na /
translated: since that echo itself is not a thing,

original: de la gang sug las mngon par 'du bgyi zhing mngon par 'du bgyis na /🔽sems can dmyal bar mchis pa'am /
analyzed: de la gang sug las mngon par 'du bgyi zhing mngon par 'du bgyis na / sems can dmyal bar mchis pa'am /
translated: “What is the karma that, when performed,🔽leads to rebirth in the hells,

original: byol song gi skye gnas su mchis ba'am /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su mchis ba'am /
translated: in the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du mchis ba'am /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du mchis ba'am /
translated: in the world of the Lord of Death,

original: lha dang mir skye ba'am /
analyzed: lha dang mir skye ba'am /
translated: or to rebirth as a god or human,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: or to rebirth as a god in the Heaven of the Four Great Kings,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three,

original: mtshe ma'i lhar skye ba'am /🔽dga' ldan gyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: mtshe ma'i lhar skye ba'am / dga' ldan gyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: in the Yama Heaven,🔽in the Tuṣita Heaven,

original: 'phrul dga'i lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'phrul dga'i lhar skye ba'am /
translated: in the Delighting in Creation Heaven,

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lhar skye ba'am /🔽tshangs ris kyi lhar skye ba'am /🔽tshangs lha nye phan gyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lhar skye ba'am / tshangs ris kyi lhar skye ba'am / tshangs lha nye phan gyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: in the Heaven of the Masters of Others’ Creations,🔽in the Brahma Realm,🔽in the Heaven of Brahmā’s Retinue,

original: tshangs pa kun 'khor gyi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa kun 'khor gyi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: in the Heaven of Brahmā’s Ministers,

original: tshangs chen gyi lhar skye ba'am /🔽snang ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: tshangs chen gyi lhar skye ba'am / snang ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
translated: in the Heaven of Great Brahmā,🔽in the Luminous Heaven,

original: chung @424a *// snang gi lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: chung @424a *// snang gi lhar skye ba'am /
translated: in the Heaven of Limited Radiance,🔽in the Heaven of Limitless Radiance,

original: tshad med snang ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: tshad med snang ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
translated: One is reborn as a god in the realm of Boundless Radiance.🔽

original: kun snang dang ba'i lhar skye ba'am /🔽dge ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: kun snang dang ba'i lhar skye ba'am / dge ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
translated: one is reborn as a god in the Heaven of Radiant Radiance,🔽as a god in the Heaven of Limited Radiance,

original: chung dge'i lhar skye ba'am /🔽tshad med dge ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: chung dge'i lhar skye ba'am / tshad med dge ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
translated: as a god in the Heaven of Limited Virtue,🔽as a god in the Heaven of Boundless Virtue,

original: dge rgyas kyi lhar skye ba'am /🔽che ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi lhar skye ba'am / che ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
translated: as a god in the Heaven of Flourishing Virtue,🔽as a god in the Heaven of Minor Increase,

original: chung che'i lhar skye ba'am /🔽tshad med che ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: chung che'i lhar skye ba'am / tshad med che ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
translated: as a god in the Heaven of Minor Increase of Happiness,🔽as a god in the Heaven of Boundless Increase of Happiness,

original: 'bras bu che ba'i lhar skye ba'am /🔽mi che ba'i lhar skye ba'am /🔽mi gdung ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i lhar skye ba'am / mi che ba'i lhar skye ba'am / mi gdung ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
translated: as a god in the Heaven of Great Increase of Happiness,🔽as a god in the Heaven of No Hardship,🔽as a god in the Heaven of Excellent Vision,

original: shin tu mthong ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba'i lhar skye ba'am /
translated: or as a god in the Heaven of Perfect Vision.
